list_definition.definition: a brass musical instrument similar to the trumpet

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She plays the cornet in a youth orchestra.

list_definition.definition: a cone-shaped wafer biscuit for holding ice-cream

list_ex_of_english: Symphonic repertoire often involves separate parts for trumpet and cornet.
He was given a cornet at five years of age, and started playing in a brass band at seven.
He was a truly unique artist, proving that cornet could be played as a modern jazz instrument.
The work has most often been played and recorded without the solo cornet part.
In cavalry companies the equivalent rank was cornet.
As a youngster, he learned to play piano, cornet and trombone.
The instruments he used most were the violin, the trumpet, the bassoon, the viola da gamba, the cornet and the sackbut.
Saille consistently incorporates real classical instruments (e.g. cello, violin, cornet, trumpet, euphonium) into their compositions, as well as strong influences from black metal.
